predicate.note: Frames file for 'crowd' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 9.7-2, Framenet entries Filling and Self-motion.

roleset.name: fill to capacity

example.name: passive, prepositional arg2
example.text: The school-board hearing at which she was dismissed was crowded *trace* with students, teachers and parents who came to testify on her behalf.
example.arg: *trace* -> The school-board hearing at which she was dismissed
students, teachers and parents who came to testify on her behalf

example.name: arg2 in subject position
example.text: ``Personal Computer'' yearbooks are lined up on nearly every desk, and dog-eared copies of Nikkei Computer crowd magazine racks.

example.name: predicative arg1
example.text: In another compartment called the Linden Bosque, 62 linden trees were *trace* to be crowded *trace* together at killing intervals of 10 or 16 feet.
example.arg: at killing intervals of 10 or 16 feet

example.name: agentive
example.text: Travelers crowded into subways, sat in traffic jams on major freeways or waited for buses in the rain, but the massive gridlock anticipated by officials in the San Francisco Bay area never materialized.
example.note: There's an understood "themselves" in arg2 position for this example.

roleset.note: Be very careful to distinguish the agent of filling (intentional) and the thing filling the container--although they can be merged, as in the last example, and in these cases the lower number wins.

roleset.name: get too close to

example.name: gimme some space, man
example.text: He no longer crowds the plate.

roleset.note: There might be some clever way to merge the two sets.
